creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: cream colored carton with tan stripes, wooden box with inscription on inside and outside of lid, wrapped in tissue; paper around scroll under tie; fabric is light green; image of landscape with tall skinny mountains and trees; small houses and a river with two figures in a boat
inscription: 青山囲四壁　中有読書寮　竹樹含寒翠　梅花照寂寥　清泉汲無尽　明月來不招　独坐耽吟詠　因知道味饒 (Green mountains encircle me—four walls, / Enclosing a hut for reading books. / Bamboo trees imbued with blue-green colors, / Plum blossoms glimmering through the silence. / A pure stream provides limitless water, / The brilliant moon comes without being called: / Here alone I sit, enjoying chanting poetry, / And realizing the richness of the flavor of Tao.) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 師在我 {shi zai ga}; poem LL red seals: 字曰子徳 {azana iwaku Shitoku}, 静處 {seisho} [seisho #3]; LRC: 我有采芝齋  {wa yū saishisai}
signed: 南海一布衣古道人 {Nankai-ichi hōi Kodōjin} (One-of-the-Southern-Sea in Informal Clothes Kodōjin)
title: Releasing the Oar in the Plum Valley
